projects.longDesc:
Retention projection is an extremely accurate way to predict LC/GC retention time, and has been used as a novel approach for compound identification / differentiation. In this project, we used 20+ calibration compounds to accurately obtain thermodynamic parameters for each GC column, thereby to predict, identify, and differentiate isomers based on accurately predicted retention times. We also had the "GC Retention Predictor" software available for every research to use, which enables accurate retention prediction with virtually any temperature program, inlet pressure/flow rate, column length, and make/model of GC instrument. The backend functions and APIs of GC Retention Predictor are implemented in Java (prototyped in VBA) with a user-friendly interface. GC Retention Predictor is open-source software distributed free of charge under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 3.0 United States License. 
 ---------- 
 Had a first-authored research article published in Journal of Chromatography A. It is titled "A practical methodology to measure unbiased gas chromatographic retention factor vs. temperature relationships", and has doi:10.1016/j.chroma.2014.11.018.

projects.shortDesc:
Optically Modulated Fluorescent Proteins (OMFPs), initially discovered and reported by us, are unique fluorescent proteins (FPs) have photo-accessible dark states. Engineering of OM-YFP further completes our OMFP color palette, which substantiates considerable potentials in revolutionizing cellular imaging. 
 ¬´¬´¬´¬´¬´¬´ Used computer-assisted 3D modeling Python software to guide site-directed mutagenesis. 
 ¬´¬´¬´¬´¬´¬´ Successfully identified and characterized several OM-YFP mutants with unique and fascinating photophysics.
projects.longDesc:
Optically Modulated Fluorescent Proteins (OMFPs) are unique fluorescent proteins (FP) possessing photo-accessible dark states. The naturally occurring dark state in OMFPs yields strong fluorescence modulation upon long-wavelength-induced dark state depopulation, allowing selective detection at the frequency at which the long wavelength secondary laser is intensity modulated. In this highly collaborative and interdisciplinary research project, we used computer-assisted 3D modeling Python software to guide site-directed mutagenesis, notably at site 65 and 148, yielding several Optically Modulated YFP (OM-YFP) mutants with unique dark state characteristics. 
 .......... 
 Furthermore, we discovered optically activated delayed fluorescence (OADF) in FPs, which was not reported before in literature. OADF takes place while the near IR secondary coexcitation repumps the emissive S1 level from the long-lived triplet state due to secondary laser-induced, reverse intersystem crossing (RISC), producing additional nanosecond-lived, visible fluorescence that is delayed by many microseconds after the primary excitation has turned off. OADF in YFPs demonstrates boundless potentials to revolutionize cellular imaging. 
 ---------- 
 Had a first-authored research article published in Journal of Physical Chemistry B. It is titled "Optically Modulated and Optically Activated Delayed Fluorescent Proteins through Dark State Engineering", and has doi:10.1021/acs.jpcb.1c00649.
projects.name: Engineering Optically Modulatable Yellow Fluorescent Proteins (YFPs)

projects.shortDesc: We are able to simulate both optical modulation and delayed fluorescence from OMFPs and other fluorophores with tremendous fidelity using our software written in Python.
projects.longDesc:
Using our in-house software written in Python, we are able to simulate both optical modulation and delayed fluorescence (OADF) simultaneously from OMFPs and other fluorophores with tremendous fidelity. 
 ---------- 
The emitted fluorescence is simulated through multi-state models using rate matrices corresponding to the Jablonski diagrams, thereby obtaining crucial photophysical parameters that are previously considered too onerous to assess. The simulation was accomplished using Python-based computation (Numpy and Pandas), optimization (Scipy), and visualization techniques (Matplotlib). We also adopted object-oriented programming (OOP) paradigm, resulting in versatile, expandable, coherent, and succinct code.
projects.name: Mathematical and Algorithmic Modeling of Fluorescence Protein Photophysics
